Package game

Class Egg

java.lang.Object
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Item
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Food
game.Egg
All Implemented Interfaces:
edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Capable, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Printable, edu.monash.fit2099.interfaces.ItemInterface
public class Egg
extends edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Food
This Egg class inherits methods and behaviours from Food Eggs represent the offspring of Stegosaurs and Allosaurs. If not eaten, an egg will hatch after some time and a baby dinosaur of the same type as the egg will be born

  • Field Summary

    Fields inherited from class edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Item

    allowableActions, capabilities, displayChar, portable

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Egg​(java.lang.String type)
    Constructor for Egg which extends Food.

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type Method Description
    boolean anyEggsToHatch​(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location location, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map)
    This method checks whether a specific egg is ready to hatch based on the number or turns its been since it was lain, If an egg is ready to hatch, it will be removed from a locations items and a baby dinosaur will be born at that location If an egg has been hatched, the player is rewarded with some eco points
    int getNumTurnsOnGround()
    Indicates how long the egg has been on the ground since lain.
    java.lang.String getType()
    Returns whether the egg is a stegosaur or allosaur type
    boolean isEdible()
    This method is only applicable to allosaur eggs
    void setEdible​(boolean edible)
    Set to false initially for allosaur eggs to ensure that an adult allosaur doesnt automatically eat an egg if it has just lain one
    void setNumTurnsOnGround​(int numTurnsOnGround)
    Changes the number of turns an egg has been on the ground
    void setType​(java.lang.String type)
    System will set the type of egg depending on the type of dinosaur that laid it

      public void setNumTurnsOnGround​(int numTurnsOnGround)
      Changes the number of turns an egg has been on the ground
      Parameters:
      numTurnsOnGround - the new number of turns the egg has been on the ground

    • getType

      public java.lang.String getType()
      Returns whether the egg is a stegosaur or allosaur type
      Returns:
      a string indicating the type of egg

    • setType

      public void setType​(java.lang.String type)
      System will set the type of egg depending on the type of dinosaur that laid it
      Parameters:
      type - string type which will match the type of the mother and father dinosaur

    • anyEggsToHatch

      public boolean anyEggsToHatch​(edu.monash.fit2099.engine.Location location, edu.monash.fit2099.engine.GameMap map)
      This method checks whether a specific egg is ready to hatch based on the number or turns its been since it was lain, If an egg is ready to hatch, it will be removed from a locations items and a baby dinosaur will be born at that location If an egg has been hatched, the player is rewarded with some eco points
      Parameters:
      location - The current location in which the egg is sitting
      map - The GameMap which the egg and location belong to
      Returns:
      A boolean indicating whether an egg has been hatched or not

    • isEdible

      public boolean isEdible()
      This method is only applicable to allosaur eggs
      Returns:
      a boolean indicating whether the egg can be eaten

    • setEdible

      public void setEdible​(boolean edible)
      Set to false initially for allosaur eggs to ensure that an adult allosaur doesnt automatically eat an egg if it has just lain one
      Parameters:
      edible - a boolean indicating whether the egg can be eaten
